Legal_Issue: Whether the Officer erred in applying procedure or making a negative substituted evaluation under IRPA
Evidence_Assessment: Ms. Roohi scored minimum points, had limited English proficiency, and teaching experience; Officer conducted interview and assessed skills
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate likelihood of economic establishment
Credibility_Factor: Officer concluded Ms. Roohi's skills were insufficient for economic establishment
Legal_Rule: Under IRPA s.76(3), an officer may substitute their evaluation if points do not reflect likelihood of economic establishment
Procedural_Issue: Application of substituted evaluation process under IRPA
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged error in procedural application and substituted assessment by Officer
Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to Officer's decision
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Officer conducted interview; process followed IRPA s.72 requirements
Key_Evidence_Considered: Language proficiency, work experience, interview performance, scoring under immigration criteria
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged Officerâ€™s use of substituted evaluation and procedural fairness
Defendant_Response: Officer provided rationale for substituted evaluation based on insufficient economic establishment indicators
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, interview assessment, application forms
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Unlikely to achieve economic establishment in Canada
Governing_Rule: IRPA s.76(3) allows substitution of assessment when point system fails to reflect economic establishment potential
